verses.kjv: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
verses.ct: This is the vision that Isaiah son of Amoz received about Judah and Jerusalem during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

verses.kjv: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for the LORD hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.
verses.ct: Listen, heavens! Pay attention, earth! The LORD has spoken: "I raised children and helped them grow, but they have turned against me."

verses.kjv: The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib: but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.
verses.ct: "An ox recognizes its owner, and a donkey knows where its master feeds it — but Israel doesn't recognize me. My people don't even stop to think."

verses.kjv: Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the LORD, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward.
verses.ct: What a sinful nation — a people weighed down with guilt, descendants of those who do evil, children who spread corruption! They have abandoned the LORD, they have insulted the Holy One of Israel, and they have turned their backs on him.

verses.kjv: Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.
verses.ct: Why do you keep inviting more punishment? You just keep rebelling! Your whole head is injured, and your whole heart is weak.

verses.kjv: From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment.
verses.ct: From the bottom of your feet to the top of your head, nothing is healthy — only wounds, welts, and infected sores that haven't been cleaned, bandaged, or treated with medicine.

verses.kjv: Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
verses.ct: Your country lies in ruins, your cities have been burned down. Right in front of you, foreigners consume your land — it is devastated, destroyed by invaders.

verses.kjv: And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.
verses.ct: The daughter of Zion is left standing alone like a small shelter in a vineyard, like a shack in a cucumber field, like a city under siege.

verses.kjv: Except the LORD of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.
verses.ct: If the LORD of hosts hadn't preserved a tiny remnant for us, we would have ended up like Sodom and been destroyed like Gomorrah.

verses.kjv: Hear the word of the LORD, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.
verses.ct: Listen to what the LORD says, you rulers who are like Sodom! Pay attention to the instruction of our God, you people who are like Gomorrah!

verses.kjv: To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith the LORD: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats.
verses.ct: "What use are all your sacrifices to me?" says the LORD. "I've had enough of burnt offerings of rams and the fat of fattened animals. The blood of bulls, lambs, and goats brings me no pleasure."

verses.kjv: When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to tread my courts?
verses.ct: "When you come into my presence, who asked you to trample through my courts?"

verses.kjv: Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with; it is iniquity, even the solemn meeting.
verses.ct: "Stop bringing meaningless offerings! Your incense is disgusting to me. Your new moon festivals, your Sabbath gatherings, your special assemblies — I can't stand them. You mix sin right in with your sacred meetings."

verses.kjv: Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them.
verses.ct: "My soul hates your monthly festivals and your scheduled celebrations. They have become a burden to me; I'm exhausted from putting up with them."

verses.kjv: And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood.
verses.ct: "When you stretch out your hands in prayer, I will look away from you. Even if you pray over and over, I will not listen — your hands are covered with blood."

verses.kjv: Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;
verses.ct: "Clean yourselves up and purify yourselves. Get rid of your evil actions from my sight. Stop doing what is wrong."

verses.kjv: Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.
verses.ct: "Learn to do what is right. Pursue justice, defend the oppressed, stand up for orphans, and advocate for widows."

verses.kjv: Come now, and let us reason together, saith the LORD: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.
verses.ct: "Come, let's settle this," says the LORD. "Even if your sins are bright red like scarlet, they can become white as snow. Even if they are deep crimson, they can become clean like wool."

verses.kjv: If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:
verses.ct: "If you are willing and obedient, you will enjoy the best that the land produces."

verses.kjv: But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken it.
verses.ct: "But if you refuse and rebel, you will be destroyed by the sword." The LORD himself has declared this.

verses.kjv: How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.
verses.ct: How has the once-faithful city turned into a prostitute! She used to be full of justice; righteousness made its home in her — but now she's full of murderers.

verses.kjv: Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:
verses.ct: Your silver has turned to worthless slag, and your wine has been diluted with water.

verses.kjv: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.
verses.ct: Your leaders are rebels and friends of criminals. Every one of them loves bribes and chases after payoffs. They don't defend orphans, and the case of the widow never reaches them.

verses.kjv: Therefore saith the LORD, the LORD of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:
verses.ct: Therefore the Lord, the LORD of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel, declares: "I will get relief from my opponents and settle the score with my enemies."

verses.kjv: And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin:
verses.ct: "I will turn my hand against you and thoroughly refine away your impurities, removing all your worthless alloy."

verses.kjv: And I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of righteousness, the faithful city.
verses.ct: "I will restore your judges like they were in the beginning, and your advisors like they were at the start. After that, you will be called the City of Righteousness, the Faithful City."

verses.kjv: Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness.
verses.ct: Zion will be rescued through justice, and those in her who repent will be saved through righteousness.

verses.kjv: And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together, and they that forsake the LORD shall be consumed.
verses.ct: But rebels and sinners will be shattered together, and those who abandon the LORD will be completely destroyed.

verses.kjv: For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.
verses.ct: You will be ashamed of the sacred oak trees you desired, and you will be humiliated because of the ritual gardens you chose.

verses.kjv: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.
verses.ct: You will become like an oak tree with withering leaves, and like a garden with no water.

verses.kjv: And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.
verses.ct: The powerful will become like dry kindling, and their works like a spark — both will burn together, and no one will be able to put out the fire.
